reviews.review_msg: Aweosome notes! Very funny guy takes off the tension of being in a MBB class. Final was long! So work fast. He's one of the few MBB prof's who has a good sense of humour. Good Luck!
Very good prof. Very fair. The final was a little too long but not overally difficult. Overall, good prof.
Good professer, very helpful to the students, note have a lot of extra info that is sometimes hard to decifer through
Dr. Craig is one of the best. She has very clear explanation of concepts. Her lecture slides are very informative, so you won't need to do much textbook reading. Overall, great prof!

Lisa Craig is a nice prof who'll answer your inquiries via email quickly. Her slides'll have everything you need to know, so you can skimp out on class. That being said-- they have quite a bit of extra information as well, attending would help you sift through what you really need to know. The class is undoubtedly a lot of work but very passable.

Very fair. You don't need the textbook, exams are 100% based on lecture powerpoints. Lecture were really dry, and didn't usually add anything that wasn't in the uploaded slides. Homework heavy (weekly assignments) but it was actually helpful in learning the material. Not hard to get a good grade if you're willing to put in the time

You can tell she's passionate about the course but lectures can be dry and there's a lot of information to absorb but she tells you everything you need to know on her lecture slides. No textbook needed. Midterms were very fair no surprises. Really enjoyed the course with her!

Her lecture slides are long but that's all you need to know. Book is pretty much useless for this course, 100% of the test comes from her lecture slides. Do tutorial assignments and quizzes because that's like a bonus 20 % for your grade.
Good lecture slides. Everything you need should be there. Don't need to textbook. Don't slack like I did...

Tests were very fair.  Lectures are well organized,  she doesn't rush the content,  it's a very manageable class.  Her lectures slides I would recommend making your own notes as hers are very long winded.  But they contain all the info you need! Didn't really use the textbook,  slides and problem sets were enough.

Her lecures are are hard to keep listening to because there's a lot of material and can be dry. Lecture slides are perfect for studying if you have the patetience to read all of it (there's a lot of words per slide). Tests are pretty easy and questions don't require as much detail as you would expect for mbb. she cares about her students!

Her lectures seem dry at first but you really have to find a way to listen cause her notes are amazing. The notes are super detailed but thats ALL you need to know. No surprises on exams. She makes it very clear what you need to know and what you don't. I loved her, she was super helpful and sweet.

Her notes are very detailed so there isn't much of a need for the textbook except to reaffirm concepts. Her exams are very fair; she expects you to know the big picture rather than the gritty details. Though she mainly reads off her slides during lectures, she is very thorough while going through them.
Fair marking, and great explanations

She is smart and knows what is relavent to the course, but she is one of the countless teachers who have been destroyed by powerpoint.
 
 spends far too much time just reading us her powerpoints.. would be much better if she just used it as a launch pad to her own thoughts.

Great prof until now in MBB department. MBB is a hard subject, but she gives you lots of hints for exams. Text is not useful at all, you will need it for 322. I got lots of helps during her office hours.

Her lectures are dry and boring and most of the time she doesn't even know what she's talking about. Midterms are fair but the final came out of nowhere! She will ask you about the tiniest details in the notes. I wasn't a big fan of MBB to start with and she just made it worse. So if find MBB to be very hard, don't take it with her.

Probably the worst instructor I have every had. It was evident that her powerpoints were "borrowed" from previous instructors - and that was reflected when the exams did not match the material covered in class. She was also completely unavailable for help, and told the class on multiple occasion " do not email me for anything ".

oOverall good teacher. Her notes are great and detailed so you barely have to touch the book. Tip: watch her youtube videos (she'll provide links in her notes) as a few questions on the final will hit what was highlighted in the videos. Tests definitely fair and not too detailed, just a little tricky with wording

another so-so prof for the biochem department. maybe its her first time teaching this course, and i dunno if its the prof or the material, her class just doesnt arouse much interest towards mbb in me. her lecture is so boring that pillow or coffee is a neccesity. the notes are OK (though she didnt make the notes herself).

Great professor, exams are more than fair (on the easy side but maybe because of the easy content), explains ideas clearly and emphasizes whats going to be on the exam, don't need the textbook as her notes pretty much cover what you will need to know.
Nice.
Great prof that got excited about course content
Demanding but very knowledgeable professor that I highly respect.

I wish this course wasn't so jam-packed so we could have a chance to ask questions. Michel is a fantastic prof who cares deeply about MBB and you can clearly see that in the passion of his teaching. I loved how he took out the final and including four term tests, although they were pretty brutal. The online homework and quizzes were great too!

Prof. Leroux's lectures were dense but he explained concepts clearly. I only ever needed to use his slides for study material as they are very comprehensive. You can tell he cares about the material and also cares about his students. Tests are hard and require you to demonstrate understanding/overlap of multiple concepts.

Dr. Leroux is absolutely amazing. Exams are extremely fair as it's just memorization, expect to know lots of the detail provided in the lectures; absolutely everything ties to each other. He is passionate and caring, ALWAYS responding to your concerns. The class is set up so that you don't need to read the textbook. Class was very smooth sailing.

He is a very reasonable proff..grades u based off multiple assessments so u always have room to boost your grade. his notes are really good and precise..his exams weren't unfair..the content was fairly heavy but he taught it really well.

Michel was able to explain concepts that I had had issues understanding in other courses in ways that I was able to understand immediately. Very impressive lecturer. The class was divided into 4 midterms, online quizzes, and assignments that were just for completion, making it very easy to boost your marks in various ways. 100% recommend.

This is the worst prof I've had since being at sfu. His midterms are super rushed for time and he makes no effort to give them back. He gave an assignment and quiz due over reading week (is that even allowed). After his lectures, I can't even tell you what we've learnt because he tries to cram in so much information so fast and goes overtime.

Dr. Leroux was a great lecturer. He was always very clear and showed real passion for the material. He includes FYI sections in every set of slides that (usually) apply to the material taught, and were typically interesting. The exams online were rather rough, and his lectures could tend to be long, but overall the course was good and enjoyable.

If you put the effort in, you'll do fine. His exams are straightforward; however, doing this course online with him was a disaster and I would personally never take another online course with him. He also does not care enough to accommodate students in case of personal emergencies, even with weeks of notice.

Dr. Leroux is a good professor. The course was quite heavy, but Dr. Leroux explained things pretty clearly. Tests were fair, and weekly assignments/quizzes were easy marks and helped with studying. Slides are very text-heavy and sometimes repetitive, but contain all the info you could need.

I would recommend taking this course with him. It's a content heavy course. He uses slides with a lot of texts and pictures, so even if you don't have time to watch the lectures, the slides would be enough to get the gist of the content. Go to tutorials, memorization alone won't help, you have to fully understand the concepts. Overall a good prof.

Michel is really nice and I love the extra notes that he drafts up which are super helpful and makes the material easy to understand. He can be a bit disorganized at times but he does listen to student feedback. I would definitely consider taking another class with him!

A very reasonable prof. You decide what your grade will be depending on your habits. Keep up, and you'll do great. No trick questions. There is a lot of material but that's with any MBB course. Exams are very fair. Open book quiz and completion marked assignment every week (aka free marks). He makes lectures interesting and explains well.

explains concepts super well. lots of information to learn but it's super interesting anyway. exams are super straightforward and easy if you read his slides. studying a day or 2 before class can get you an A- on the exam. weekly quizzes and assignments help with studying and it also gives you free marks (basically an extra 20%)
Wasn't a fan of his lectures, but his tests were mostly straightforward.

A fine prof but if you can find a better one then I definitely recommend avoiding Leroux. He reads from the slides (which aren't his own) and goes really slowly in a super soft and monotone voice, which put half his class to sleep. Only reason why he was an okay prof was that his exams were fair and it wasn't too difficult to get a decent mark.

Dry content, each lecture was on average 40 slides packed full of text, which makes it a very material dense course. Most work I've ever put into a course in my life with discouraging results. Do not recommend. Not curved. Spring 2017 Final average was 58%.
Dr. Leroux is a nice guy but lectures get very dry.  LOTS of material.

Michel is a teacher who is genuinely excited about the subject. A little shy and self-deprecating, he tries hard to make the material make sense, and is always willing to go over things between class. That said, it IS an information-dense subject, so a good bit of reading and work on your own is required to do well. I found study groups helpful.

Dr. Leroux is a great prof. He made a course like MBB which is filled with details very interesting and fascinating. Truly a legend when it comes down to presenting lectures in the most effective and simplistic manner. If you go over his lecture notes thoroughly, you should be able to earn a decent grade. Had great time with him this spring!

There is a lot of material covered in MBB222, but Dr. Leroux makes an incredible effort to try and present the info as clear as possible. PP tend to be long and wordy, but if you follow thru w all the slides, you will not need to dwell in the textbook.

Honestly, I can't speak for people taking Upper Division classes with Dr. Leroux, but as someone in his MBB222 class, I think he's one of the best you can get. He can be a bit dry at times, and his lectures can be quite heavy, but that's MBB. It's a dense course and Dr. Leroux is SUPER approachable and friendly. Easiest and most friendly prof ever.

Absolutely amazing prof. He would put videos on youtube to further explain topics and show examples, and was fully acessible for extra help. Super friendly, but does expect you to work (but only as much as him-which is a lot).
A great lecturer in the MBB dept.  Would recommend to take any MBB class with him.  Not easy, but makes the material clear and concise.

Dr. Chu is amazing. This class, however is pretty hard, but you just need to put in work. He tells you what's important and what to avoid which saves a lot of time, and also has review sessions which is a major key. He actually takes time to know the people he interacts with and if very kind and helpful. 10/10 professor!

He is a fun exciting prof that most people love! He is good at explaining concepts, great at giving you  extra time outside office hours. Seems genuinely interested in the happiness and success of his students. He prepares you well for exams and the exams are pretty fair. Totally recommend him as your professor! :)

I had Eugene for MBB 222 in summer 2015 and he was amazing!! he explained everything really thoroughly, and made sure to repeat concepts that (historically) students had trouble with. His practice midterms were a really good reflection of his exams. He's patient, available, and very open to constructive criticism. hands down best prof ever :)

I had Professor Chu for MBB 222 and he was awesome! MBB can be boring but he really puts in the effort to make the class interesting, and to help you get a good grade, and if youre not doing too good, to make sure you pass. I was in his class fall 2014, the first one he was teaching, and i definitely recommend him over any of the other profs.

ALWAYS available for extra help. I did badly on a midterm and he personally emailed me to check in and invite me to his office hours to go over the material. Tough material, tough exams, tough grading (he doesn't scale), but always fair, always respectful towards students, always obviously happy to be there.

Great professor. He follows all the aspects of a good teacher and if he was doing any other course, would be my most favorite professor thus far.  Mbb 222 is a hard course, no matter who teaches it. Eugene just makes it a little easier.  Power point slides seem to come from the department, but Eugene tells you what to know, and what to ignore.
Unless you have prepared or you have extremely good skill of memorization, don't enroll in MBB 222 no matter what prof you choose.
GREAT PROF, VERY CLEAR POWERPOINT SLIDES (TEXTBOOK ISN'T REQUIRED) EXAMS ARE BASED STRICTLY OFF LECTURE NOTES, AND REQUIRES A LOT OF MEMORIZATION.
Dr. Chu is really nice, and is always open to helping you out. A lot of memorization is required which potentially makes the midterms and final hard-- they are however fair though.
Great prof, The class is very difficult in itself, but Eugene makes it somewhat straightforward. Reuses a lot of practice questions in his exams!!!

Good prof who likes to teach and wants students to do well. There is a lot to cover though so he flies through 30 - 40 slides per lecture. He will make it clear though what will come up on the exams and they were fair overall. The class kinda sucks no matter who the prof is...

Incredibly approachable. Go to his office hours and he'll explain everything really well until you fully understand; He's always willing to help. There is a lot of work required but it's biochemistry so that's not shocking. Tells you exactly what you need to know, removes as much as he can. Super fair midterms and final IF you put in the work!
He is a good prof, although the course content is a bit dense, his exams are really fair!
Very nice professor! He really tries to do what he thinks is best for his students. His tests were extremely fair.  Very approachable.
He tries his best to engage students and make lectures fun. Tests were fair. Good prof.

He seems very interested in the material but he isn't very good at explaining it to the class. He isn't specific on what to study for the midterms and exams, and his practice midterms and exams do not provide a realistic picture of the actual midterm and exam received. You definitely need to study every little thing for his class.

Dr. Chu is a  new prof, and you can definitely tell. He tries to being engaging, which is nice, but often doesn't clearly communicate what material is importantwhat needs to be known for exams. Really nice guy, tries to do what's right, just inexperienced. Over study for his exams.

Dr. Chu is an awesome prof. Made Microbiology a lot less daunting. Very friendly, approachable, and goes out of his way to help students. Also very creative with review sessions to help with studying.
DO NOT take MBB with HONDA, the lectures are awefully boring and his exams are unfair!

he likes to put problems rather then simple memorizing questions on his midterm and final. thats fine if he actually gave us some problems to practice on beforehand. whenever people would ask him for questions he would say to find them ourselves! all we did in tutorial was spend time preparing a presentation that was 15 min long.

His lectures were boring and didn't explain further than his posted notes. He was constantly distracted by people leaving etc and made comments about it mid-sentence. Tests were fair, all written answers though. Poor attitude towards students. Not very helpful.
I never see a professor who underestimates university students more than anybody else.

Worst prof ever. bad attitude. never on time for lecture. missed 6 lectures in one semester. notes are in his word, only he can understand. exam seems reasonable, but he doesn't teach much, he covers everything too briefly. bad bad bad
